result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P Gromowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 5 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration NOR the Substance Abuse Programs.

miscConds.notes: Cash Bail Applied to Court Costs and DNA Surcharge.  Paid In Full.  Remaining bail refunded to poster

Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Follow through with any current treatment and/or any counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with: Amber S. or her residence.
Attend Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha.
DNA Sample to be provided, if not yet previously done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time:  60 Days - Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael P Gromowski in court with Attorney David John Molter.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Molter makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

5 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 5 days)
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions/sign releases
____Follow through with any current treatment and/or any counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - 1/2 must be work/employment
____No contact with: Amber S. or her residence
____Domestic Violence Counseling through a State Certified Batterers Intervention Program such as Alliance Counseling or Family Services of Waukesha;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder to be returned to poster)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days,   Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Hearing on June 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.
